Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Souffl'e \Souf`fl['e]"\, a. [F., fr. souffl['e], p. p. of souffler to puff.] 1. (Ceramics) Decorated with very small drops or sprinkles of color, as if blown from a bellows. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. (Cookery) Often

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Souffle \Souf"fle\, n. [F.] (Med.) A murmuring or blowing sound; as, the uterine souffle heard over the pregnant uterus. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Souffl'e \Souf"fl['e]\, n. [F., fr. souffl['e], p. p. of souffler to puff.] (Cookery) A side dish served hot from the oven at dinner, made of eggs, milk, and flour or other farinaceous substance, beaten till very light, and flavored with fruits, liquors, or essence. [1913 Webster]
souffle n : light fluffy dish of egg yolks and stiffly beaten egg whites mixed with e.g. cheese or fish or fruit
